name: reference emissions
note: Reference specific emissions to calculate the CO2 constraint. In the original model by Duan et al. these are the specific emissions for electricity generation from natural gas.

name: battery storage
note: cf. with var_cost of 1e-8 per kWh_e in original model

name: battery charge
note: '=SQRT(0.9) to match 0.9 efficiency of battery together with (dis-)charge process in original model

name: battery discharge
note: '=SQRT(0.9) to match 0.9 efficiency of battery together with (dis-)charge process in original model

name: nuclear heat storage
note: cf. with var_cost of 3.71e-9 per kWh_e in original model

name: natural gas
note: cf. with var_cost of 0.02097 USD/kWh_e in original model

name: natural gas
note: Fuel (“carrier”: natural gas) to electricity efficiency.

name: natural gas with CCS
note: cf. with var_cost of 0.027192 USD/kWh_e in original model

name: natural gas with CCS
note: Modified efficiency to represent lower CO2 emissions: For a quick & dirty implementation of lower CO2 emissions from NG+CCS power plant assume a higher “natural gas to electricity” efficiency, such that electricity generation happens at lower specific emissions (original specific emissions of NG without CCS: 0.47 t_CO2 / MWh_e; with CCS: 0.17 t_CO2/Mwh_e).
